shorts.title: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.2M in health care costs
shorts.title_distilled: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.
shorts.description: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content_distilled: Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.

shorts.title: Two women and a service dog killed in machete attack, police say
shorts.title_distilled: Two women and a service dog killed in machete attack, police say.
shorts.description: SCRANTON, Pa. (WNEP) - Two women were killed and another was hospitalized from a machete attack in Pennsylvania. Police in Scranton said they are still investigating the machete attack at the Hotel Jermyn apartments on Tuesday night. Two women and a service d…

shorts.title: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to Board of Directors
shorts.title_distilled: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.

shorts.title: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud
shorts.title_distilled: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud.
shorts.description: Two Pennsylvania state troopers have filed a lawsuit against Gov. Josh Shapiro and others, claiming they faced retaliation after reporting payroll fraud within the department.

shorts.title: Lackawanna County Court Notes, January 9, 2026
shorts.description: MARRIAGE LICENSE Ana Alejandra Gonzalez Marte and Joseph Anphernee Rosado Fontanez, both of Scranton. PROPERTY TRANSACTIONS Matthew C. and Suzanne Swientisky, Waverly Twp., to Jesse and Bridget Vipond, Dalton; a property at 210 Sugarbush Road, Waverly Twp., for $840,000. KG Realty Holdings LLC to Gregory M. and Breana Shaffer; a property at 915 Johns Drive, Moosic, for $255,000. PMPZ Realty LLC to 203 Chestnut LLC; two parcels in Dunmore for $305,000. Scott G. and Patricia A. Fisher, Jefferson Twp., to Lane and Domenica Shellenberger Hassenplug, Olyphant; a property at 2011 Second Ave., Jefferson Twp., for $371,000. Gustav and Chelsey Hensel […]

shorts.title: Clipboard, January 9, 2026
shorts.description: Carbondale Soup sale additions: Trinity Episcopal Church, 58 River St., is having a homemade soup sale starting now until sold out. Available soups are chicken noodle, Italian wedding, beef barley, pasta fagioli and cabbage roll, $5/pint and $9/quart. Chili and stew are available for $6. Stop by weekdays, 9 a.m.-1 p.m. Call office for availability, 570-282-3620. Regional Organ and Catholic Liturgy: King’s College free public program on “The Organ and Catholic Liturgy,” Feb. 9, 7 p.m., George & Giovita Maffei Family Commons, 29 W. North St., Wilkes-Barre. The program is sponsored by the Pennsylvania Northeast Chapter of the American Guild […]
shorts.content: Carbondale Soup sale additions: Trinity Episcopal Church, 58 River St., is having a homemade soup sale starting now until sold out. Available soups are chicken noodle, Italian wedding, beef barley, pasta fagioli and cabbage roll, $5/pint and $9/quart. Chili and stew are available for $6. Stop by weekdays, 9 a.m.-1 p.m. Call office for availability, 570-282-3620. Regional Organ and Catholic Liturgy: King’s College free public program on “The Organ and Catholic Liturgy,” Feb. 9, 7 p.m., George & Giovita Maffei Family Commons, 29 W. North St., Wilkes-Barre. The program is sponsored by the Pennsylvania Northeast Chapter of the American Guild […]

shorts.title: Fraternal Order of Police donates to the Gino J. Merli Veterans Center
shorts.title_distilled: Fraternal Order of Police donates to the Gino J.
shorts.description: The Fraternal Order of Police has demonstrated its generosity by donating a new bingo board and machine to support resident activities at the Gino J. Merli Veterans Center in Scranton. The veterans center staff and residents expressed thanks and appreciation to the FOP for the kindness and generosity demonstrated through the donation. Top row, from left: Chris Hallock, Justin Butler, Michael Cammerota, Jack Powell, Janice McAllister, Pamela Wood, Sarah Ruggiero, Vito P. Ruggiero and Joseph Chiochio. Front row: Paul Boylan, Joseph Keenan and Carl Fink.
shorts.content: The Fraternal Order of Police has demonstrated its generosity by donating a new bingo board and machine to support resident activities at the Gino J. Merli Veterans Center in Scranton. The veterans center staff and residents expressed thanks and appreciation to the FOP for the kindness and generosity demonstrated through the donation. Top row, from left: Chris Hallock, Justin Butler, Michael Cammerota, Jack Powell, Janice McAllister, Pamela Wood, Sarah Ruggiero, Vito P. Ruggiero and Joseph Chiochio. Front row: Paul Boylan, Joseph Keenan and Carl Fink.
shorts.content_distilled: Fraternal Order of Police has demonstrated its generosity by donating a new bingo board and machine to support resident activities at the Gino J.

shorts.title: BOYS BASKETBALL NOTEBOOK: Valley View, Scranton Prep set for Division I showdown
shorts.title_distilled: BOYS BASKETBALL NOTEBOOK: Valley View, Scranton Prep set for Division I showdown.
shorts.description: As expected, based on nonleague and tournament games, the Lackawanna League season is going to be filled with tight, competitive battles in the quest for division titles and seeding for the District 2 tournament. The energy and excitement will continue Friday night, with a focus on games featuring top-ranked teams in The Times-Tribune Boys Basketball Poll. In Division I, No. 2 Valley View (10-0 overall, 2-0 in division) is undefeated as it heads into a rivalry game with No. 3 Scranton Prep (7-2, 3-0), winners of six in a row, at the Xavier Center with a 6:45 p.m. tip. Valley […]

shorts.title: GIRLS BASKETBALL: Defense rallies Valley View past Scranton Prep
shorts.title_distilled: GIRLS BASKETBALL: Defense rallies Valley View past Scranton Prep.
shorts.description: BLAKELY — In a game full of defensive stops, Valley View had the one at the end that mattered most. The Cougars held Scranton Prep scoreless for the final 2:41 to rally for a 45-40 victory over the Classics in a Lackawanna League Division I girls basketball thriller Thursday night at Valley View High School. Cora Castellani collected 23 points, four rebounds, three assists, five steals and two blocks for Valley View (3-0 league, 10-1 overall), which is ranked No. 1 this week in the Times-Tribune Top 10 poll. Ava Gazoo added 10 points. Chloe Mamera led No. 4 Scranton […]
shorts.content: BLAKELY — In a game full of defensive stops, Valley View had the one at the end that mattered most. The Cougars held Scranton Prep scoreless for the final 2:41 to rally for a 45-40 victory over the Classics in a Lackawanna League Division I girls basketball thriller Thursday night at Valley View High School. Cora Castellani collected 23 points, four rebounds, three assists, five steals and two blocks for Valley View (3-0 league, 10-1 overall), which is ranked No. 1 this week in the Times-Tribune Top 10 poll. Ava Gazoo added 10 points. Chloe Mamera led No. 4 Scranton […]

shorts.title: COLLEGE FOOTBALL: Former Scranton Prep star Montgomery commits to Florida
shorts.title_distilled: COLLEGE FOOTBALL: Former Scranton Prep star Montgomery commits to Florida.
shorts.description: London Montgomery, the Scranton Prep graduate, is heading to the Southeastern Conference. The dynamic running back, who started his collegiate career at Penn State before transferring to East Carolina, entered the transfer portal and, while on a visit, announced his commitment to the University of Florida via his X account on social media. “I am really excited,” Montgomery said while watching the College Football Playoff semifinal between Miami and Ole Miss. “I am still down here, and I am going to get back home, and I want to get back down here as fast as I can and get to […]
shorts.content: London Montgomery, the Scranton Prep graduate, is heading to the Southeastern Conference. The dynamic running back, who started his collegiate career at Penn State before transferring to East Carolina, entered the transfer portal and, while on a visit, announced his commitment to the University of Florida via his X account on social media. “I am really excited,” Montgomery said while watching the College Football Playoff semifinal between Miami and Ole Miss. “I am still down here, and I am going to get back home, and I want to get back down here as fast as I can and get to […]
shorts.content_distilled: London Montgomery, the Scranton Prep graduate, is heading to the Southeastern Conference.

shorts.title: Teen charged in connection with stolen vehicle in Scranton
shorts.title_distilled: Teen charged in connection with stolen vehicle in Scranton.
shorts.description: A 14-year-old faces charges including theft of a motor vehicle, receiving stolen property, and fleeing and eluding police.
